column4: Can someone translate* this for me?  "I had trouble mounting this too, but it turns out it is actually a binary installer (not an image). just make it executable (chmod 744 or something) and run the bin."
Nickrud: All I get is "bash: /home/dan/MAPLESOFT.Maple.v11.0.Linux-AGAiN: is a directory"
Nope, it came in the separate 5mb pieces PIECE.r1, PIECE.r2, PIECE.r3...
Nickrud: No clue, in Windoze I could just make it into an .iso and mount/burn, but I don't know how to in Linux
There is a great program to mount images
There are also nautilus scripts you can use to do this also.. although I haven't had luck with that one yet..
Right I see.. Yah it should be able to be run then and it should self compile.. Atleast thats how it works in winblows
What did you say the other files were? You said something about a binary??
I haven't used parted rar files in linux but in windows you just start the first .rar and all the parts self extract and make on big file
Ok so lets say you run the .bin file?
Or I think you can also click on the icon to run it too from nautilus?
The file browser.. from what ive gathered thats what it is
